entry.title: It Matters Where You Are
entry.summary:
Author: bigmouthstrikes_again

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,159Chapters: 1/2Kudos: 12

Summary: As Bruce leaned over the edge, he envisioned the humanistic panic he would feel plummeting towards the icy river, and then the pang of pain he would experience upon impact with the water. His brain visualized the calm that would settle over him as he swirled in the frigid depths of the torrent, and he mindlessly leaned farther over the barrier, closer to the silence. . . ‚ÄúUh,‚Äù he heard a voice say from behind, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre not gonna jump, are you?‚Äù OR Bruce is having a rough day when he meets Clark- a ball of joy reporter from the Daily Planet, visiting Gotham for a business trip. entry.title: Body Language
entry.summary:
Author: NotCassia

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,875Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 69

Summary: The crowds being kept at a distance hadn't been the only people interested in Batman. The GCPD had been eyeing Bruce since he'd gotten on the scene. And Clark tried to justify it for a while. Some people still didn't think Batman was real so seeing him in broad daylight was certainly an experience. But Clark had run out of excuses when one of the officers had tried to march up to Bruce with cuffs, suddenly brave after only hovering at Clark's periphery. Clark swivelled on the officer tunnel-visioned on Batman's retreating back. He hadn't intended for it, but his heat vision had crackled to life with a resounding and sharp‚Äî!FRRSSHH!‚Äîthat cut through the scene like a soft whip. The officer, alongside some of his colleagues in closer range, flinching back. Batman completely forgotten. entry.title: The Company We Keep
entry.summary:
Author: WrenA

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,987Chapters: 11/11Kudos: 144

Summary: They say you can tell a person by the company they keep and all Barry could say about Superman was that he was far from the goodie-two-shoes everyone made him out to be initially. If you were to go by said company:- The colleagues at the Daily Planet and especially Lois and Jimmy- Clark's parents who always send sweets- Clark's close friend, Thomas, who sports a permanent stubble, disheveled hair and dark circles under the eyes- The mysterious 'B' who Superman sometimes calls to call in a favor when something requires a more tricky investigation- Nightwing, who is part of the league but acts incredibly familiar to Supes- An assortment of friends that he keeps mentioning- A (possible) crime lord whose file keeps getting deleted from the Watchtower databases- An array of vigilantes that absolutely refuse to join the league and have an unhealthy obsession for bats- THE BATMAN!? THE BATMAN IS REAL and does Superman know BATMAN!?- Lex Luthor, a homicidal billionaire- Bruce Wayne, not a homicidal billionaire, just annoying- Superman's kids?!? Or glimpses into the life of Superman over time, as seen through the eyes of one Barry Allen.
